body.name: Vantrue N4 3 Channel 4K Dash Cam, 4K+1080P Front and Rear, 1440P+1440P Front and Inside, 1440P+1440P+1080P Three Way Triple Car Camera, IR Night Vision, 24 Hours Parking Mode, Support 512GB Max
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Sunday, February 18. Order within 1 hr 38 mins
Or fastest pickup Tomorrow 7 AM - 11 AM. Order within 38 mins
features: 【Three Channel Front Inside Rear Dash Cam】The N4 is a triple channel dash cam which offers 155° front camera, 165° inside camera and 160° rear camera, it can simultaneously monitor the front, rear, and interior of your vehicle while providing audio at 1440P + 1440P + 1080P, protecting you from potential accidents and liability issues.

【4K & 1080P Front and Rear Dual Dash Cam】When set to front and rear dual recording mode, the cam provides a 4K 2160P resolution front camera and a 1080P rear camera. The rear camera can be effortlessly adjusted up to a full 360° angle with its convenient 20ft extension cable, making it suitable for various vehicles such as cars, SUVs, jeeps, and trucks. The front camera can seamlessly record up to 4K when used alone, ensuring crystal-clear visibility of license plates and road signs.

【1440P & 1440P Front and Inside Dual Dash Cam】You can configure the settings to record the front and interior of your whole cabin in 1440P + 1440P high resolution. The adjustable inside camera ensures more flexibility and better viewing, ideal for rideshare drivers that may need to present proof of activities within the vehicle.

【Infrared Night Vision Car Camera for Drivers】With high-performance STARVIS CMOS sensor, a big F1.4 aperture 6-glass lens observing road front, F1.8 6-glass lens observing rear, this car camera is able to increase exposure automatically in dark situations for capture clear videos footage; 4 IR LED lights facing the car cabin, which can accurately capture the driver and passengers even when the cabin is completely dark, perfect for rideshare drivers such as Uber, Lyft and Taxi.

【24 Hours Parking Mode】With low bitrate recording parking mode, the dash cam will keeps recording continuously and decreases the quality of the video to maximize the recording quantity. While the motion detection or collision detection parking mode allows the camera to automatically initiate recording when triggered by a motion or collision event. The 3 channel dash cam should be connected to the hardwire kit at all times (buy extra ASIN B083XB8T7T) or an external battery.

【Heat Resistant with Super Capacitor】This camera is powered by a super capacitor built to survive extreme weather conditions from 14°F to 158°F, making it ideal for extreme hot-weather or cold-weather areas. The super capacitor also extends the lifespan of the batteries further than lithium-ion batteries.

【Reliable Witness for Accident】Variable sensitivity G-sensor auto detects sudden shake/collision and emergency locks the footage to event folder following impact. Loop recording auto overwrite the oldest file when card is full. Auto LCD off avoid distracting. Optional GPS (need to buy separately B083XBS88L) to track route, location and speed in KM/H or MP/H. Capable of housing up to 512GB of external memory (not in the box, recommend Vantrue sd card).

【18m Warranty】This camera comes with an extendable 18-month warranty, costumer support through email within 24 hours, and a 100% satisfaction guarantee. Also, the product will receive firmware updates for continuous improvements and new features. 20ft rear camera cable, fits for most cars. 30ft extension cable(Buy separately, the package only includes the 20ft rear camera cable) available for big suvs. Note: It DOESN’T support WiFi or Bluetooth.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars One of the best 3 channel Dash cam you can buy
reviews.reviewText: I am upgrading from Ventrue N2 Pro dash cam to the new N4 Dash cam.The reason for upgrade is because I was in a 3 car accident, someone rear-ended me, and push my car bump into the car in front of me. When there is no clear evidence to show who caused the accident, 3 car accident can be a messy lawsuit. With camera footage on hand, it is so easy to determined who is at fault and don't have to worry about lawsuit.Because N2 Pro do not have rear camera, I decided to get an upgrade and try the Vantrue N4 Dashcam. I am very impressed with the N4 on the price and video quality. The video quality is wonderful no matter day or night you get the best video compare to other dash cameras. Front Camera is at 2K or 1440P resolution, cabinet and rear cameras are at FHD or 1080P, all at 30 frames per second. and you can purchase the hardwire kit to have it monitor your car 24/7, which is what I did.One can find all the dash camera specs on Amazon page, so here is what I think the pro and con to this dash cameraPRO1. The video quality is impressively good, I am able to get good video from all 3 camera lens in day or night. A clean windshield and rear window also make huge difference. Night vision is so clear both inside and outside of the car. With new CMOS sensor and F1.4 aprture in the front, night time video is super clean. and 4 IR LED lights for interior camera help to see everything inside the car in night time as well.2. The Dash cam take up to 256GB of Micro SD card, since you have 3 lens all working at same time and at full resolution a 3 minutes clips from all 3 cameras will be about 700MB in size, you will need large SD memory card to hold all the video footage.3. Super capacitor instead of tiny battery is a must for hot or cold weather. I had many other dashcams that come with tiny battery pack, none of those dashcam will last long in extreme hot weather. In summer the temperature inside a car can go all the way to 150-160F, those tiny battery pack won't last a summer. Capacitor are weather resistant and I don't have to worry about dead dash cam when I need it.4. Larger LED screen is a godsend, because you have 3 camera view now, the larger LED make it much easier to read. and you can switch between different 3 cameras to the main screen to monitor. It is easy to operate and review the clip.5. Wiring the rear camera is surprisingly easy. I was worry about wiring the rear dash cam to my car, but after watch some Youtube video and read other feedback, I was able to do it in 15 minutes. Maybe my Camry is just easy to do it, I didn't have problem to hide all the wire and make it look good.CON1. No Wifi or App support. I think with today's digital age and smart phone, the dash should come with a quick way to access video footage wirelessly to download and share.2. No internal GPS support. a builtin GPS will be a nice feature, you will have to buy GPS mount if you want to get GPS data on the dash cam.3. No Y cable to power and connect to rear dash cam. you will need to run two cables to the main dash cam, one for the rear camera to the side of the main unit, and another cable to provide power on the mounting unit of the main camera. Wish there is a Y cable I can connect both USB C connector to have just one single cable to run to the main unit.4. Video is on codec h.265 format, if you have older computer, it might not support h.265 format. I understand why they need to use h.265 codec because all 3 cameras at 2K or FHD do increase the video size, and h.265 has better efficiency compare to the h.264. So don't be surprise when you try to watch the 2K video on your 8 years old laptop, the video is not able to play, you can still hook up the dash cam directly to your 60+ inch TV with Micro HDMI cable. Another way you can do is upload it to Youtube and it will encode again but you will lost quality on the video.Overall: The Vantrue N4 is a very good upgrade from N2 Pro, and one of the best 3 channel dash camera you can buy in the market. If you need to get a dash camera for you car, don't settle on the budget camera that will go bad in a year, get the N4 and have peace of mind to know it will work every time you start the engine with clear video when you need it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Solid product so far, with an actual response from customer service
reviews.reviewText: Bought this after a fairly brief look at online comparisons. Installed this system in a 2016 extra long MB Sprinter based RV. Suction mount reasonably secure. Rear camera mounts with UHB tape, and they include an extra piece if you want to move it. Setup was trivially easy. Video quality is good. Video is *not* 4k on the front camera unless you run it by itself; best you can do with all three cameras running is 1440p front and 1080p cabin and rear at 30 fps. That resolution is, however, more than adequate for anything I want to do with the camera. Files are stored time stamped, in mp4 format, with an 'A', 'B', or 'C' at the end of the file name to indicate which camera it came from. Event recorder is a little touchy with factory setting, which is OK. 'Event' files get stored in a separate directory from the continuous ones so they don't get overwritten as soon. You can force the current recording into the Event directory by touching the leftmost button on the top. All in all a fairly sane setup.Cons: No wireless access to the files, let alone live feed. I can sort of understand this as it would increase power consumption, but in an age when your refrigerator has wifi your dash cam should have some kind of wireless capability. I was unable to get the camera to connect to a Linux laptop via USB-C, but the laptop could read the card just fine in its own reader. The screen is pretty small if you want a usable backup camera. To get GPS tagging on your files you have to buy a separate GPS mount... but its cheap. I like the camera well enough that I ordered the GPS mount (which uses UHB tape instead of a suction cup). Rear camera view at night is just black without additional light (pretty hard problem to solve with the camera mounted behind tinted glass -- could put an IR LED on the back of the van I suppose but not sure if the back camera does IR). Side view on the front camera is blacked out at night (again, hard problem to solve when you have full headlight illumination in the center of the field of view, so acceptable).Pro: They actually seem to have a customer service department! I mounted the camera in a vehicle that is over 21 feet bumper to bumper. The 6 meter cable they include for the rear camera, which would be fine in almost any other vehicle, isn't long enough to do any kind of sane cable management in the van. The cable is USB-C on one end, but the end that plugs into the camera is a weird, I assume proprietary 1/16" or so 4 conductor phono plug. It wasn't clear whether a USB-C extender would work. I looked for a longer cable online and there was nothing (except, it turns out, on the Amazon Japan website). I contacted the company via email and received a prompt, intelligible reply; turns out they have a 9 meter cable available in China and Japan, and they are sending one.Unknowns: I haven't been in a position to evaluate whether files will finish saving before the power goes out in a wreck (see another review that mentions this). I am hopeful that the high bond tape mount will help with this if it ever becomes an issue. I am not sure how well the GPS position and speed tagging works, but hope to find out soon. Another reviewer mentioned a problem with the GPS format.All in all seems like a solid product so far, and one of very few solutions if you want a camera looking ahead at the road, another looking at the cop coming up behind you, and a third to show that you weren't texting, weren't speeding, and didn't do anything suspicious.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Camera works really well. Images are clear. Transfer to storage it's easy enough by removing the SDcard and connecting it to (in my case) Mac. Only note, at times, (probably if car is switched quickly on/off) the camera fails, happened only once, so not really a concern and not sure what happened (I had it for 6 months now).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good unit, possible quality issues
reviews.reviewText: Update: After some back and forth with customer support and sending them more information about the problem, they sent me a replacement camera. I've updated my review to reflect that and my general happiness with the camera itself.For 18 months (not coincidentally the length of the warranty), I loved this dashcam. It was easy to set up and operate, and the picture quality from all three cameras was great.At 19 and a half months, the main (front) camera died. Tried the basic stuff - reboot, update firmware - with no luck. So I contacted support. In fairness, they responded quickly and were at least polite. However, there response was that their corporate policy was to provide no support for any hardware issue outside of the warranty period, nor would they offer a paid repair option, and I would have to buy a completely new camera from them to resolve the issue.I knew the camera was out of warranty; I was ready to pay even half the cost of the camera to get it fixed. But at $300, I expect a camera to last at least two years and to get more than an 'oh well, bad luck for you' from support even outside the warranty period.

Me gustó el servicio al cliente y lo mejor, es que el producto cumple con lo que dice, es fácil de instalar. Requiere de una unidad SD en específico. No he presentado ningún problema de sobrecalentamiento, desprendimiento de la cámara o de que drene la batería del carro.
El producto llegó en buenas condiciones, la cámara incluye una cámara adicional para grabar la parte trasera del adentro, más las dos cámaras para grabar el interior y frente del auto.

Es una cámara excelente ya que la instalé me siento con una seguridad cuando salgo de casa o carretera tiene una buena calidad de resolución de video Magnífico cuando se pone en modo nocturno y el material excelente calidad (Esperando comprar otra cámara ) recomiendo 💯
Me gustaría accesar a los videos más fácil con el teléfono, solo se puede por medio de una laptop. 🥲
Fácil de instalar y discreta, cableando todo no se nota que la tienes instalada, hasta ahora a funcionado perfectamente
